abstract: A stretch of the Grand Concourse in the Bronx, an artists' colony in the far West Village and the Paul Robeson Theater were awarded landmark protection on Tuesday.
snippet: A stretch of the Grand Concourse in the Bronx, an artists' colony in the far West Village and the Paul Robeson Theater were awarded landmark protection on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The city gave an Art Deco-filled stretch of the Grand Concourse in the Bronx - along with an artists' housing complex in the West Village, a church-turned-synagogue-turned-theater in Brooklyn and a Staten Island cottage - landmark protection on Tuesday.

headline.main: The Grand Concourse Gets Its Due
